report_title: Online Original Design T-Shirt Sales in the US
executive_summary: The executive summary provides an overview of the Online Original Design T-Shirt Sales industry in the US. Key points: - Industry operators sell custom-made T-shirts for men and women via company-owned online outlets. - Demand for online original design T-shirts has grown over the five years to 2022, as consumers have increasingly shopped with e-tailers for convenience and price comparison. - Industry operators have benefited from a rise in the number of mobile internet connections. - IBISWorld estimates that industry revenue expanded an annualized 3.4% over the five years to 2022, reaching $608.1 million, despite an anticipated 0.8% decline in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the five years to 2022, industry operators have benefited from greater consumer accessibility to online storefronts. The number of broadband connections has grown at an annualized rate of 1.4% during the five-year period, which has increased the pool of consumers with access to industry goods.

Despite strong revenue and profit growth, increasing levels of internal competition over the five years to 2022 have pressured industry operators. During the current five-year period, the number of industry participants has expanded rapidly at an annualized rate of 5.7% to 275 companies.

While the prominence of traditional original design T-shirt e-tailers has remained steadfast during the current five-year period, several industry-relevant e-tailers have altered their business model to differentiate themselves from competitors in recent years.

Similar to the broader retail sector, the outbreak of COVID-19 (coronavirus) has fostered a detrimental operating environment for industry participants, leading to declining industry revenue in 2020. Unemployment soared in 2020, causing declines in per capita disposable income and consumer spending.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Similar to the previous period, the number of broadband connections is anticipated to expand. As a result, the total pool of potential industry customers will grow. Moreover, e-tailers are expected to represent a larger share of overall retail sales.

Furthermore, many industry operators are expected to incorporate mobile applications to expand accessibility to online storefronts. For example, Threadless, one of the largest industry players, launched a mobile application in 2014.

Internal competition is expected to rise as industry revenue continues to increase, attracting new competitors to enter the industry. Over the five years to 2027, the number of industry operators (i.e. industry-relevant websites) is forecast to grow at an annualized rate of 1.6% to 298 companies.

In June 2018, the US Supreme Court ruled in favor of a shift in policy, in which online retailers are now required to collect sales tax on transactions that take place within a state, whether or not the company has a physical presence in that state. This new legislation could hamper industry operators' profit.

industry_definition: This industry sells T-shirts for men and women via company-owned outlets online. These items are typically offered exclusively through the company's.
key_trends: Increasing levels of internal competition have pressured industry operators
Several industry-relevant e-tailers have altered their business model
Intense price-based competition has contributed to a decline in profit

market_segmentation.segment_description: Individuals in this age cohort are typically tech savvy and are accustomed to making purchases online, which serves as a boon to industry operators.
While these consumers are the most likely to have jobs that require formal dress, the increasingly relaxed dress codes have made it more acceptable for consumers to wear T-shirts to work.
Many consumers in this age demographic are retired and may opt for a more casual style of dress.

products_and_services.product_description: T-shirts designed for women make up 28.1% of total industry revenue.
Unisex and men's T-shirts account for an estimated 54.7% of total industry revenue.
In 2022, IBISWorld estimates that Children's T-shirts represent 17.2% of total industry demand.
In 2022, IBISWorld estimates that Children's T-shirts represent 17.2% of total industry demand.
In 2022, IBISWorld estimates that Children's T-shirts represent 17.2% of total industry demand.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: As the number of broadband connections increases, a greater share of the population will make purchases from online-based businesses.
As disposable income levels increase, consumers are more likely to purchase the discretionary clothing retailed by industry operators.
The world price of cotton, a major input for T-shirts, also plays a role in demand.

business_locations.location_description: The West holds 24.0% of industry establishments.
The Southeast holds 22.8% of industry establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic holds 16.9% of industry establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The sellers must be cautious when printing logos, as they may be protected by trademarks or copyrights.
In June 2018, the US Supreme Court ruled that states can require internet retailers to collect sales taxes, even if they do not have a physical presence in the state.
Industry operators are also subject to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC)'s Mail, Internet or Telephone Order Merchandise rule.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition is primarily based on price.
Competition is primarily based on product quality and variety.
Competition is primarily based on shopping convenience.
Competition is primarily based on website organization and load speed.
Competition is primarily based on order processing and fulfillment.
Competition is primarily based on order delivery time.
Competition is primarily based on customer service.
Competition is primarily based on brand recognition.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The largest player, CustomInk LLC, generating an estimated 25.8% of industry revenue in 2022.
The industry has become increasingly fragmented as low barriers to entry have encouraged new players to set up shop.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases vary between retailers, as some industry operators choose to print on a variety of materials; however, cotton T-shirts are the most common purchase made by industry operators.
Over the five years to 2022, the world price of cotton has increased at an annualized rate of 6.7%.
Additionally, due to supply chain disruptions in 2020 and 2021 stemming from coronavirus, purchase costs have become somewhat volatile.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry spends $0.19 on capital expenditures for every dollar spent on wages.

The Online Original Design T-Shirt Sales industry carries a moderate level of capital intensity, with most investment requirements in the form of warehouse space, computer equipment, printing equipment and a shirt inventory.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Over the five years to 2022, the Online Original Design T-Shirt Sales industry has exhibited moderate level of revenue volatility.
The industry is primarily affected by per capita disposable income, the number of broadband connections and the percentage of services conducted online.

However, the outbreak of COVID-19 (coronavirus) triggered a drop in consumer spending in 2020 as a result of increasing economic uncertainty, which negatively affected demand for industry products during that year.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Changes in printing technology in recent years have had a profound effect on the industry, as operators have an increasing portfolio of printing options to offer customers.
Changes in internet technology have also strongly affected the industry. Industry operators rely entirely on the internet to promote and sell products.
Using technology to design a smartphone-compatible website has also become increasingly important in recent years.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: While most industry operators retail a diverse range of products, such as hats and bags, only T-shirts are considered industry-relevant goods.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Although many consumers consider apparel to be an essential product, the specialized nature of the industry's goods make them nonessential. Therefore, the health of the industry is heavily dependent on the state of the economy.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs negatively affected your company's sales?
FAQs.answer: The world price of cotton has grown in recent years, pushing up purchase costs for industry players over the past five years.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand reach and reduce overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Merger and acquisition activity is not popular within this industry, though struggling operators will often sell off unprofitable segments of their business.

FAQs.question: How does your company utilize new technology in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Since the industry is entirely based online, operators must utilize the most up-to-date technology in order to remain relevant.

FAQs.question: How has your company reacted to the rise of online sales over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: The industry benefits from growth in online sales since the industry is entirely based online.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly affected profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: While regulation has not recently had a significant effect on this industry, pending regulation could have a large effect on margins going forward. Currently, operators need not collect sales tax in states where they do not have a physical presence; this may change going forward.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Some industry operators opt to join retail trade associations in order to ensure that they are compliant with health and safety requirements.

FAQs.question: How have input prices affected profit margins over the past year?
FAQs.answer: The world price of cotton has a strong effect on industry profit margins since cotton is a major input in T-shirts.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Many industry players pride themselves on high customer retention rates.

FAQs.question: Do you have strong-word-of-mouth recommendations? Are you able to leverage social media to spread the word about your company?
FAQs.answer: The industry is highly competitive; operators that receive positive word-of-mouth recommendations are likely to have an advantage.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your clientele comprises repeat customers? How do you ensure customers will want to use your services again?
FAQs.answer: It is important to have a loyal customer base to attract repeat buyers and ensure continued sales. Establishing a loyal customer base may take time and require continuous communication with customers.

FAQs.question: Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology? Have you been able to develop mobile applications to remain competitive?
FAQs.answer: Given the industry's reliance on information technology for sales, operators must upgrade software and personal information security systems to remain efficient and competitive.

FAQs.question: How has rising competition from clothing stores affected your revenue? How do you differentiate your products from those found in brick-and-mortar stores?
FAQs.answer: Operators are affected by competition from substitute industries that provide the same or similar products. Clothing and clothing accessory stores, in particular, create competition for operators. As consumers buy more products from physical stores, demand for online T-shirts falls.

FAQs.question: Have you found your revenue trends in line with disposable income levels? Can you lower prices when per capita disposable income decreases?
FAQs.answer: Since industry goods are generally considered discretionary, demand for the industry is directly correlated with disposable income. As disposable income rises, consumers are more likely to purchase new apparel items such as T-shirts.

FAQs.question: How will you take advantage of rising levels of internet connectivity? Is your website easy to navigate on multiple online platforms?
FAQs.answer: This industry is sensitive to the penetration rate of broadband internet. When the number of broadband connections increases, a larger proportion of the population has access to e-tailers, stimulating demand for online original design T-shirts.
